I am trying to attach a scrollbar to a Text widget in my Python code. While I am able to place a very small scrollbar right next to my Text field, the scrollbar is so small that I can only see the up and down arrows but nothing in between. The code I have used to achieve this is as follows:

```python
self.scroller = Scrollbar(self.root)
self.scroller.place(x=706, y=121)
self.outputArea = Text(self.root, height=26, width=100) 
self.outputArea.place(x=0, y=120)
self.scroller.config(command=self.outputArea.yview)
self.outputArea.config(state=DISABLED, yscrollcommand = self.scroller.set)
```

Although I can scroll with it when my text field fills up, I want to know if there is a way to set the height of the scrollbar so that it appears to be the same height as the text field?

To make the scrollbar the same height as the `Text` widget, you should ensure that both the `Text` widget and the `Scrollbar` are placed within the same geometry management system. Using the `place()` geometry manager can be a bit tricky for aligning widgets dynamically, and it usually involves a lot of manual adjustments. Instead, consider using the `pack()` or `grid()` geometry manager, which are more suited for this kind of layout.

Here’s how you can achieve this using the `pack()` method:

```python
from tkinter import Tk, Text, Scrollbar, RIGHT, LEFT, Y

root = Tk()

# Create a Text widget
outputArea = Text(root, height=26, width=100)
outputArea.pack(side=LEFT, fill='both', expand=True)

# Create a Scrollbar and link it to the Text widget
scroller = Scrollbar(root, command=outputArea.yview)
scroller.pack(side=RIGHT, fill=Y)

# Configure the Text widget to work with the Scrollbar
outputArea.config(state='normal', yscrollcommand=scroller.set)

root.mainloop()
```

In this code:

- The `Text` widget is packed to the left side and is allowed to fill both horizontally and vertically (`fill='both'`), and it expands to take up available space (`expand=True`).
- The `Scrollbar` is packed to the right side and fills vertically (`fill=Y`).
- This setup ensures that the `Scrollbar` is the same height as the `Text` widget.

Using `pack()` or `grid()` helps maintain a more consistent layout as the window is resized or the application is scaled. If you still prefer `place()`, you would have to manually calculate and adjust the height of the scrollbar based on the geometry of the `Text` widget and the window, which can be cumbersome.
